name: ULevelStreaming
doc:
Abstract base class of container object encapsulating data required for streaming and providing
interface for when a level should be streamed in and out of memory.

WorldAsset: The reference to the world containing the level to load
LevelTransform: Transform applied to actors after loading.
LevelColor: The level color used for visualization. (Show -> Advanced -> Level Coloration)
EditorStreamingVolumes: The level streaming volumes bound to this level.
MinTimeBetweenVolumeUnloadRequests: Cooldown time in seconds between volume-based unload requests.  Used in preventing spurious unload requests.
OnLevelLoaded: Called when level is streamed in
OnLevelUnloaded: Called when level is streamed out
OnLevelShown: Called when level is added to the world and is visible
OnLevelHidden: Called when level is no longer visible, may not be removed from world yet
StreamingPriority: The relative priority of considering the streaming level. Changing the priority will not interrupt the currently considered level, but will affect the next time a level is being selected for evaluation.
bShouldBeVisible: Whether the level should be visible if it is loaded
bShouldBeLoaded: Whether the level should be loaded
LevelLODIndex: Requested LOD. Non LOD sub-levels have Index = -1
bIsStatic:
Whether this level only contains static actors that aren't affected by gameplay or replication.
If true, the engine can make certain optimizations and will add this level to the StaticLevels collection.
bShouldBlockOnLoad: Whether we want to force a blocking load
bShouldBlockOnUnload: Whether we want to force a blocking unload
bDisableDistanceStreaming:
Whether this level streaming object should be ignored by world composition distance streaming,
so streaming state can be controlled by other systems (ex: in blueprints)
bDrawOnLevelStatusMap: If true, will be drawn on the 'level streaming status' map (STAT LEVELMAP console command)

methods.name: CreateInstance
methods.doc: Creates a new instance of this streaming level with a provided unique instance name

methods.name: GetIsRequestingUnloadAndRemoval
methods.doc: Returns if the streaming level has requested to be unloaded and removed.

methods.name: GetLoadedLevel
methods.doc: Gets a pointer to the LoadedLevel value

methods.name: GetWorldAssetPackageFName
methods.doc: Gets the package name for the world asset referred to by this level streaming as an FName

methods.name: IsLevelLoaded
methods.doc: Returns whether streaming level is loaded

methods.name: IsLevelVisible
methods.doc: Returns whether streaming level is visible

methods.name: IsStreamingStatePending
methods.doc: Returns whether level has streaming state change pending

methods.name: SetIsRequestingUnloadAndRemoval
methods.doc: Sets if the streaming level should be unloaded and removed.

methods.name: SetLevelLODIndex
methods.doc: Sets the world composition level LOD index and marks the streaming level as requiring consideration.

methods.name: SetPriority
methods.doc: Sets the relative priority of considering the streaming level. Changing the priority will not interrupt the currently considered level, but will affect the next time a level is being selected for evaluation.

methods.name: SetShouldBeLoaded
methods.doc:
Virtual that can be overridden to change whether a streaming level should be loaded.
Doesn't do anything at the base level as should be loaded defaults to true

methods.name: SetShouldBeVisible
methods.doc: Sets the should be visible flag and marks the streaming level as requiring consideration.

methods.name: ShouldBeLoaded
methods.doc:
Return whether this level should be present in memory which in turn tells the
streaming code to stream it in. Please note that a change in value from false
to true only tells the streaming code that it needs to START streaming it in
so the code needs to return true an appropriate amount of time before it is
needed.

@return true if level should be loaded/ streamed in, false otherwise
